p: The MI ratios were consistently high, with the lowest ratio of 0.74 occurring in males during 2016. Overall, the MI ratio decreased from 1.00 in 1997 to 0.76 in 2016 (β=−0.014, p<0.0001), with an annual rate of change of −1.44%. The annual rates of change in the MI ratio for males and females were −1.50% and −1.23%, respectively (online supplementary table 2). Additionally, the MI ratios showed decreasing trends in both males (β=−0.012, p<0.0001) and females (β=−0.014, p<0.0001), but there was no significant trend in magnitude in these two groups (t=−1.64, p=0.109) ( figure 4).
